title: Android 13 finally adds native support for DNS over HTTPS
content:
Android has supported DNS-over-TLS (DoT) since Android 9.0 Pie. It’s available in your phone’s Network & internet settings under the name Private DNS. In September last year, a code change spotted in the Android Open Source Project (AOSP) suggested that Google was planning to add DNS over HTTPS support in Android 13. And, itâ€™s now

The post Android 13 finally adds native support for DNS over HTTPS appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Android 13 finally adds native support for DNS over HTTPS (DoH). DNS over HTTPS uses HTTP or HTTP/2 protocols to encrypt DNS traffic.
